Build a custom accessible component with lrtiste behaviours

In this tutorial we are going to assume that for any reason you can't use the default HTML5 checkbox input and we are going to build an accessible dual state checkbox widget from scratch using lrtiste programmatic behaviours

Contents

  • The markup
  • The style
  • The script

We make sure our widget has the role checkbox and a label (in our case it will be contained within our widget). We set the value of tabindex to 0 so that our element can be focused

the empty span element will be a visual feedback on the current state of the checkbox


<div role="checkbox" tabindex="0"><span aria-hidden="true"></span><span>check Me</span></div>

CSS

We are going to use the aria state aria-checked as a css selector in our stylesheet.

check Me
